info.title: Nexus Host API
info.description: API available to Nexus plugins for interacting with the host system. Plugins authenticate via OAuth 2.1 client_credentials grant (POST /oauth/token) and use the access token as a Bearer token.

get.summary: List extensions declared by the calling plugin.
get.description:
Only returns extensions the plugin declared in its manifest `"extensions"` field.
Includes availability status (is it installed and running?) and per-operation
permission status. Plugins cannot see extensions they didn't declare.

post.description:
Three-layer security model:
1. PERMISSION: Does this plugin have `ext:{ext_id}:{operation}`?
2. SCOPE: If the operation declares `scope_key`, is the scope value approved?
3. RISK: If risk_level is high, per-invocation runtime approval.

403.description: Forbidden — extension not found, missing permission, or scope denied

400.description: old_string not found or not unique

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Base directory to search from (must be absolute)

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: File or directory to search in (must be absolute)

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Optional glob filter for file names (e.g. "*.ts")

parameters.name: context_lines
parameters.description: Number of context lines around matches (default: 0)

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: Maximum number of matching files to return (default: 50)

get.description:
Returns all enabled extensions with the `credential_provider` capability
that the calling plugin has a `credential:{ext_id}` permission for
(any state including deferred).

post.description:
Permission model mirrors extension operations:
1. Check `credential:{ext_id}` permission (Active/Deferred/Revoked)
2. Check scope approval for the requested scope
3. Call the extension's `resolve` operation

403.description: Forbidden — missing permission or scope denied

get.description:
Returns the calling plugin's identity, version, status, and permissions
with their current states and approved scopes.
Returns CPU, memory, and network statistics for the calling plugin's container.

get.summary: Get settings for the authenticated plugin.
get.description:
Returns a flat key-value map. Defaults from the manifest are
applied first, then any explicitly saved overrides.

put.summary: Update settings for the authenticated plugin.
put.description:
Accepts a flat key-value map. Values are validated against the manifest's
settings schema: unknown keys are rejected, value types must match.

CredentialProvider.description: A credential provider in the list response.

args.description: Arguments to pass to the command

working_dir.description: Working directory (must be absolute). Defaults to home directory.

timed_out.description: Whether the command was killed due to timeout

is_context.description: Whether this line is a context line (vs a direct match)

MetaPermission.description: Permission entry in the self-introspection response.

PluginExtensionView.description: A plugin's view of an extension it declared as a dependency.

PluginOperationView.description: A plugin's view of an operation on a declared extension.

PublishRequest.description: Lightweight publish request from extensions — the host fills in the rest.
